title: Restore original clean dashboard UI with integrated functional components

requirements.summary: Restore the original sidebar and main content spacing from the 'Nishant' dashboard version with Deep Onyx (#050505) background and Emerald (#10b981) accents
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard uses Deep Onyx (#050505) as the primary background color
Emerald (#10b981) accent color is applied consistently to interactive elements
Sidebar spacing matches the original clean, high-density layout
Main content area spacing provides adequate breathing room while maintaining density

file_operations.description: Update CSS variables to use Deep Onyx (#050505) as the primary background color for both light and dark themes. Update accent colors to use Emerald (#10b981) consistently across interactive elements, buttons, and hover states.

Restore original sidebar spacing with clean, high-density layout. Update background colors to Deep Onyx (#050505) and ensure Emerald (#10b981) accents are applied to sidebar navigation items, active states, and interactive elements. Adjust main content area padding to provide adequate breathing room while maintaining density.

requirements.summary: Display a clean and prominent 'Welcome back' header at the top of the dashboard
acceptanceCriteria: Welcome back header is visible at the top of the dashboard
Header text is legible with appropriate font size and weight
Header stands out visually without cluttering the interface

file_operations.description: Add a clean and prominent 'Welcome back' header at the top of the dashboard page. Use appropriate font size (text-2xl or text-3xl) and weight (font-semibold) to make it stand out. Position it above the existing metric cards grid without cluttering the interface.

requirements.summary: Create a Control Panel card in bento style with toggles for Neural Shield and Stealth Mode that log toggle actions to the telemetry feed
acceptanceCriteria: Control Panel card is displayed as a clean, non-cluttered bento-style card
Neural Shield toggle is present and functional
Stealth Mode toggle is present and functional
Toggle state changes are logged to the telemetry feed with timestamps
Toggle states persist during the session

file_operations.description: Create a new ControlPanel component using BentoCard for styling. Include two toggle switches using shadcn/ui Switch component for Neural Shield and Stealth Mode. Use React state with useState to manage toggle states. Implement sessionStorage to persist toggle states during the session. When toggles change state, emit events that can be consumed by the TelemetryFeed component. Use Lucide icons (Shield and EyeOff) in Emerald (#10b981) color next to each toggle label.

requirements.summary: Add an Active Plan card displaying 'Sovereign Enterprise' as a badge with a Log Out button positioned nearby
acceptanceCriteria: Active Plan card is displayed as a small badge/card in bento style
Card shows 'Sovereign Enterprise' plan name clearly
Log Out button is positioned near the Active Plan display
Log Out button is visually distinct and easily accessible

file_operations.description: Create a new ActivePlanCard component using BentoCard for styling. Display 'Sovereign Enterprise' as a badge using shadcn/ui Badge component with Emerald accent styling. Position a Log Out button nearby using shadcn/ui Button component with appropriate styling. The Log Out button should use the logout functionality from useInternetIdentity hook to clear AXON_SESSION and redirect to the login page. Use a Lucide icon (Crown or Sparkles) for the plan badge and LogOut icon for the button.

requirements.summary: Implement a compact scrolling Telemetry Feed on the right side of the dashboard displaying logged events
acceptanceCriteria: Telemetry Feed is positioned on the right side of the dashboard
Feed displays events in a compact, scrollable format
Feed auto-scrolls to show newest entries
Feed captures toggle actions from Control Panel
Feed entries include timestamps

file_operations.description: Create a new TelemetryFeed component that displays a compact scrolling log of events. Use React state to maintain an array of log entries with timestamps. Implement a custom event listener or React context to receive toggle events from ControlPanel. Display entries in reverse chronological order with auto-scroll to bottom using useEffect and scrollIntoView. Style with Deep Onyx background, compact padding, and scrollable overflow. Format timestamps using toLocaleTimeString. Limit feed to last 50 entries to prevent memory issues.

Create a React context to manage telemetry events across components. Provide a TelemetryProvider that maintains the event log state and exposes a logEvent function. Export a useTelemetry hook for components to add events to the feed. This allows ControlPanel to log toggle actions that TelemetryFeed can display.

requirements.summary: Add a Team Status card showing a simple list of active users
acceptanceCriteria: Team Status card is displayed in bento style within the main grid
Card shows a clean list of active users
User list is easy to scan and non-cluttered
Active status is visually indicated for each user

file_operations.description: Create a new TeamStatusCard component using BentoCard for styling. Display a simple list of 3-4 mock active users (e.g., 'Alex Carter', 'Jordan Lee', 'Morgan Blake') with ActiveStatusIndicator component next to each name. Use a clean vertical list layout with appropriate spacing between users. Include Lucide Users icon in Emerald (#10b981) color as the card header icon.

requirements.summary: Maintain localStorage authentication logic where AXON_SESSION existence determines dashboard vs Sign-In display
acceptanceCriteria: When AXON_SESSION exists in localStorage, dashboard is displayed
When AXON_SESSION does not exist, Sign-In page is displayed
Session check occurs on app initialization
No changes to existing localStorage authentication flow

file_operations.description: Verify that ProtectedRoute components correctly check for AXON_SESSION in localStorage via the localStorageAuth utility. Ensure dashboard routes (/command-center, /analytics-vault, etc.) remain wrapped in ProtectedRoute. No modifications to the authentication logic itself - only verification that the existing flow is intact.

requirements.summary: Ensure Log Out button clears AXON_SESSION from localStorage and redirects user to Sign-In page
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking Log Out removes AXON_SESSION from localStorage
User is redirected to Sign-In page after logout
Session state is completely cleared on logout
No dashboard content remains accessible after logout

file_operations.description: Ensure the Log Out button in ActivePlanCard calls the logout function from localStorageAuth utility (imported from frontend/src/utils/localStorageAuth.ts) to clear AXON_SESSION from localStorage, then uses TanStack Router's useNavigate to redirect to the login page (/login). Clear any React Query cache using queryClient.clear() if applicable.

Verify that the existing logout functionality in DashboardLayout correctly clears AXON_SESSION using the localStorageAuth utility and redirects to /login. Ensure queryClient.clear() is called to remove any cached user data.

requirements.summary: Configure Neural Scan transition to play only once upon successful login, not on subsequent page loads
acceptanceCriteria: Neural Scan transition plays immediately after successful login
Transition does not replay on subsequent dashboard visits during the same session
Transition state is tracked to prevent duplicate playback
User sees smooth transition from login to dashboard exactly once per session

file_operations.description: After successful login (when setCurrentUser is called and AXON_SESSION is created), set a sessionStorage flag 'NEURAL_SCAN_PLAYED' to 'true'. Before redirecting to /command-center, check if this flag exists. If it doesn't exist, trigger the Neural Scan transition animation. If it exists, skip the transition and redirect immediately.

Create a NeuralScanTransition component that displays a fullscreen scanning animation (using animated SVG or canvas with scan lines effect and Emerald accent color). Component should check sessionStorage for 'NEURAL_SCAN_PLAYED' flag on mount. If flag is present, don't render. If absent, show the animation for 2-3 seconds, then set the flag and call an onComplete callback to proceed to the dashboard.

Add conditional rendering logic to show NeuralScanTransition component immediately after login if the 'NEURAL_SCAN_PLAYED' sessionStorage flag is not set. Ensure the transition wraps the navigation from login to dashboard, preventing dashboard render until transition completes.

requirements.summary: Remove all redundant logos and Initializing screens from the dashboard interface
acceptanceCriteria: No duplicate logos appear on the dashboard
Initializing screens are removed from the dashboard flow
Dashboard loads directly without unnecessary loading states
Interface is clean without visual redundancy

file_operations.description: Remove any redundant logo displays (multiple instances of axon-logo.dim_800x800.png or aegis-logo variants) from the CommandCenter page. Remove any 'Initializing...' loading states or screens that appear after authentication. Keep only essential loading skeletons for async data fetching.

Remove any redundant logo displays from the sidebar or header in DashboardLayout. Ensure only one logo instance appears in the sidebar if needed. Remove any 'Initializing' screens or unnecessary loading overlays from the layout component.

requirements.summary: Standardize all dashboard icons to use the Lucide icon set with Emerald (#10b981) color
acceptanceCriteria: All icons in the dashboard use the Lucide icon library
Icons are colored with Emerald (#10b981)
Icon set is consistent across all dashboard components
No mixed icon libraries or inconsistent icon styles remain

file_operations.description: Ensure all icons in ControlPanel use Lucide React icons (Shield, EyeOff) with className='text-emerald-500' or inline style color='#10b981' for consistent Emerald color.
Ensure all icons in ActivePlanCard use Lucide React icons (Crown or Sparkles for plan, LogOut for logout button) with Emerald (#10b981) color styling.
Ensure the Users icon from Lucide React is used with Emerald (#10b981) color for the card header.
Use Lucide React icons (Activity or Radio) for the telemetry feed header with Emerald (#10b981) color. Ensure any event-type icons in the feed also use Lucide with consistent styling.

Review all icons used in CommandCenter page (metric cards, section headers) and replace with Lucide React equivalents (Shield, Database, Activity, etc.) using Emerald (#10b981) color. Remove any non-Lucide icon imports.

Standardize sidebar navigation icons to use Lucide React (LayoutDashboard, Lock, FileText, Settings, LogOut) with Emerald (#10b981) color for active/hover states. Ensure consistent icon sizing and spacing.
